Description: Sherd of a faience (?) cylindrical vessel with vertical wall and flat rim; traces of light blue-green slip on the inner face
Curator's comments: See also the similar items London, BM, EA 23812, and Boston, MFA, 87.152 (deacc.) also from Tell Dafana, and the comment from W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72 about London, BM, EA 23812 : "A piece of a pot of refractory material, in which blue frit has been prepared in the furnace, for blue paint, was also found in the camp; it is just like what occured in the sacarab factory at Naukratis, and points to a manufacture of blue-glazed articles".
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.227, pl.69)
